qas.question: What is often misunderstood as the cause of matter rigidity?

answers.text: repulsion of like charges under the influence of the electromagnetic force
the repulsion of like charges under the influence of the electromagnetic force

qas.question: What actually causes rigidity in matter?
What is needed to pack electrons densely together?
How is the Pauli exclusion priciple manifested in the macro world?

plausible_answers.text: quantum mechanical state as other electrons

qas.question: Since electrons are minions, they cannot occupy the same what?
When electrons are loosely packed, there is not enough what?
What takes no energy to pack them together?
When what are packed together loosely is there not enough lower energy?
